text: Still this extraordinary silence appeared strange to him, and had established himself very comfortably between his knees, his head in his hands, tried to collect his scattered thoughts.

passages.fragment: Still this extraordinary silence appeared strange to him , and
passages.full_quote: <used>Still this extraordinary silence appeared strange to him, and</used> he called a second and third time; still no answer

passages.fragment: to him , and had established himself very comfortably between his knees , his
passages.full_quote: Upon issuing forth from his subterranean retreat at the expiration of five minutes, he found the abbé seated upon a wooden stool, leaning his elbow on a table, while Margotin, whose animosity seemed appeased by the unusual command of the traveller for refreshments, had crept up <used>to him, and had established himself very comfortably between his knees, his</used> long, skinny neck resting on his lap, while his dim eye was fixed earnestly on the traveller's face

passages.fragment: his knees , his head in his hands ,
passages.full_quote: I will confess that I was far too much taken up with what was going on to be of the slightest use as sentry; indeed, I had already deserted my eastern loophole and crept up behind the captain, who had now seated himself on the threshold, with his elbows on <used>his knees, his head in his hands, a</used>nd his eyes fixed on the water as it bubbled out of the old iron kettle in the sand

passages.fragment: his head in his hands , tried to collect his scattered thoughts
passages.full_quote: During this time, Edmond, seated on his bed with <used>his head in his hands, tried to collect his scattered thoughts</used>
